data.title: Lights, camera, attitude
data.meta_description: Same shoes on too, scuffed suede loafers. They're twinned.
data.text:
Same shoes on too, scuffed suede loafers. They're twinned. "No way," says Bevan, checking out his partner's feet. He speaks grudgingly, with the natural weariness of someone born handsome. "Mine are shoes, his are booties."

Spooky couple. They look like clapped-out copywriters from an ad agency time forgot, yet both, legend has it, are multimillionaires. They grin. Trying to drive a wedge between them is impossible. Getting what you want from them, whether negotiating, interviewing or just bantering, can be pretty tough too.

And that, everyone tells me, is the key to their success: tight as a team, more than the sum of their parts, Bevan and Fellner have manoeuvred themselves into position as the most successful British producers of their generation, bosses of Working
